DataElement.preferredName: Non Brain Tissue Donor Collection Begin And Fixation Post Death Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The verification of whether non-brain tissue donor tissue collection and fixation post death meets the eligibility requirements.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non Brain Tissue Donor Collection And Fixation Post Death Requirement Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The cessation of life._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is it likely that tissue coll
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is it likely that tissue collection can be started AND the first tissue can be placed in fixative within 8.0 hours of cardiac cessation or recorded time of death (observed or presumed) for a non-brain donor?
